events.content: Zhang Guimei, founded, the Huaping High School for Girls,
events.origin: In August 2008, Zhang founded the Huaping High School for Girls, a free high school so that poor girls living in the mountains can get an education.

events.content: Zhang Guimei, became, a delegate to the 17th National Congress of the Communist Party of China,
events.origin: In 2017, Zhang Guimei became a delegate to the 17th National Congress of the Communist Party of China.

events.content: Zhang Guimei, stipulated that, tuition and accommodation fees are all free,

events.content: Zhang Guimei, decided to, raise money for establishing a school,
events.origin: To raise money for establishing a school, between 2002 and 2007, Zhang spent the summer and winter vacations on the streets in the provincial capital city Kunming, asking people to donate.
events.dimension: Principal of Huaping High School for Girls

events.content: Zhang, came across, "many girls that just disappeared before they finishing they studies",
events.origin: When Zhang taught in Huaping County, Zhang Guimei came across "many girls that just disappeared before they finishing they studies".
events.dimension: Principal of Huaping High School for Girls

events.content: Zhang, joined, the Communist Party of China,
events.origin: In April 1998, he joined the Communist Party of China.

events.content: Zhang Guimei, was, diagnosed with uterine fibroids,
events.origin: In the same year, Zhang Guimei was diagnosed with uterine fibroids.

events.content: Zhang's husband, was, diagnosed with advanced stomach cancer,
events.origin: In 1993, her husband was diagnosed with advanced stomach cancer.
In 1990, Zhang Guimei married Dong Yuhan, an ethnic Bai man.
In December of the next year, Zhang Guimei entered the workforce and became a staff member of Zhongdian County Forestry Bureau.

events.content: Zhang Guimei, moved, to the Forestry Children's School in Dali Bai Autonomous Prefecture,
events.origin: Zhang Guimei moved to the Forestry Children's School in Dali Bai Autonomous Prefecture (now Xizhou No.1 High School) with her husband

events.content: Zhang's father, died, when Zhang was 17,
events.origin: Zhang father died when Zhang was 17.

events.content: 17-year-old Zhang Guimei, followed sister, to participate in the "Third Front" to Zhongdian County,
events.origin: In October 1974, Zhang Guimei followed Zhang Guimei sister to participate in the "Third Front" to Zhongdian County (now Shangri-La City) in southwest China's Yunnan.

events.content: Zhang, was born, into a family of ethnic Manchu minority group in Mudanjiang Heilongjiang,
events.origin: Zhang was born into a family of ethnic Manchu minority group in Mudanjiang, Heilongjiang, on 15 June 1957.
